title: Error: MongoDB connection failed
message: Failed to connect to MongoDB
causes: Incorrect MongoDB connection string.
MongoDB server is not running or unreachable.
solutions: Check the MongoDB connection string for accuracy.
Ensure the MongoDB server is running and accessible.

title: Error: Authentication failed
message: Failed to authenticate with MongoDB
causes: Incorrect username or password.
Authentication mechanism is not properly configured.
solutions: Verify the username and password in the connection string.
Ensure the correct authentication mechanism (e.g., SCRAM-SHA-256) is used.

title: Error: Invalid MongoDB query
message: MongoDB query returned an error
causes: Syntax error in the query.
Query contains unsupported operators or fields.
solutions: Check the query syntax and ensure it is valid.
Refer to MongoDB documentation for supported operators and fields.

title: Error: Schema validation failed
message: Document does not match the schema
causes: Required fields are missing in the document.
Data types do not match the schema definition.
solutions: Check the schema definition and ensure all required fields are provided.
Validate data types before inserting or updating documents.

title: Error: Duplicate key error
message: Document with the same key already exists
causes: Unique index violation.
Duplicate key inserted into a collection.
solutions: Check the unique index constraints on the collection.
Ensure no duplicate keys are inserted.

title: Error: Write operation failed
message: Failed to perform a write operation (insert, update, delete)
causes: Insufficient permissions for the operation.
Write concern is not satisfied.
solutions: Check user permissions for the collection.
Adjust the write concern settings if necessary.

title: Error: Read operation failed
message: Failed to perform a read operation (find, aggregate)
causes: Insufficient permissions for the operation.
Query is too complex or inefficient.
solutions: Check user permissions for the collection.
Optimize the query or add indexes to improve performance.

title: Error: Index creation failed
message: Failed to create an index on a collection
causes: Index key exceeds the maximum size limit.
Duplicate index name or key pattern.
solutions: Ensure the index key does not exceed the size limit.
Use a unique name or key pattern for the index.

title: Error: Aggregation pipeline failed
message: Aggregation pipeline returned an error
causes: Syntax error in the pipeline stages.
Unsupported operators or expressions in the pipeline.
solutions: Check the pipeline stages for syntax errors.
Refer to MongoDB documentation for supported operators and expressions.

title: Error: Transaction failed
message: MongoDB transaction could not be completed
causes: Transaction conflicts with another operation.
Transaction exceeds the maximum time limit.
solutions: Retry the transaction after a short delay.
Increase the transaction timeout if necessary.

title: Error: Connection pool exhausted
message: Too many connections to MongoDB
causes: Connection pool size is too small.
Connections are not being released properly.
solutions: Increase the connection pool size in the MongoDB driver settings.
Ensure connections are released after use.

title: Error: Timeout during operation
message: MongoDB operation timed out
causes: Network latency or server load.
Operation is too complex or inefficient.
solutions: Optimize the query or operation to reduce execution time.
Increase the timeout setting in the MongoDB driver.

title: Error: Invalid BSON data
message: BSON data is malformed or invalid
causes: Incorrect data types in the BSON document.
Data exceeds the maximum BSON size limit.
solutions: Check the data types in the BSON document.
Ensure the BSON document does not exceed the size limit (16MB).

title: Error: Sharding configuration failed
message: Failed to configure sharding for a collection
causes: Incorrect shard key or configuration.
Sharding is not enabled on the MongoDB cluster.
solutions: Choose an appropriate shard key for the collection.
Enable sharding on the MongoDB cluster.

title: Error: Replica set configuration failed
message: Failed to configure a replica set
causes: Incorrect replica set configuration.
Network issues between replica set members.
solutions: Check the replica set configuration for errors.
Ensure network connectivity between replica set members.

title: Error: Change stream error
message: Failed to create or use a change stream
causes: Change stream is not supported on the MongoDB version.
Insufficient permissions to create a change stream.
solutions: Ensure the MongoDB version supports change streams.
Check user permissions for the collection.

title: Error: GridFS operation failed
message: Failed to perform a GridFS operation (upload, download)
causes: File exceeds the maximum size limit.
GridFS bucket is not properly configured.
solutions: Ensure the file size is within the allowed limit.
Check the GridFS bucket configuration.

title: Error: Atlas cluster connection failed
message: Failed to connect to a MongoDB Atlas cluster
causes: Incorrect Atlas connection string.
IP address is not whitelisted in Atlas.
solutions: Check the Atlas connection string for accuracy.
Whitelist the IP address in the Atlas dashboard.

title: Error: Atlas cluster scaling failed
message: Failed to scale a MongoDB Atlas cluster
causes: Insufficient permissions to scale the cluster.
Cluster is already at the maximum or minimum size.
solutions: Check user permissions for the Atlas cluster.
Ensure the cluster is within the allowed size limits.

title: Error: Atlas backup failed
message: Failed to create or restore a MongoDB Atlas backup
causes: Insufficient permissions to perform backup operations.
Backup storage limit is exceeded.
solutions: Check user permissions for backup operations.
Increase the backup storage limit if necessary.

title: Error: MongoDB Atlas cluster not responding
message: MongoDB Atlas cluster is unresponsive or slow
causes: High load on the cluster due to heavy queries.
Network issues between the application and Atlas.
solutions: Optimize queries to reduce load on the cluster.
Check network connectivity and latency between the application and Atlas.

title: Error: MongoDB connection dropped
message: Connection to MongoDB was unexpectedly dropped
causes: Network instability or server downtime.
MongoDB server terminated the connection due to inactivity.
solutions: Implement connection retry logic in the application.
Increase the connection timeout settings in the MongoDB driver.

title: Error: MongoDB cursor timeout
message: MongoDB cursor timed out during iteration
causes: Cursor was open for too long without being used.
Query took too long to execute.
solutions: Use `noCursorTimeout` option for long-running queries.
Optimize the query to reduce execution time.

title: Error: MongoDB bulk operation failed
message: Bulk write operation returned an error
causes: One or more documents in the bulk operation failed validation.
Bulk operation exceeded the maximum batch size.
solutions: Check the documents for validation errors.
Split the bulk operation into smaller batches.

title: Error: MongoDB TTL index not working
message: TTL index is not deleting expired documents
causes: TTL index is not properly configured.
Documents do not have a valid date field for the TTL index.
solutions: Ensure the TTL index is set on a date field.
Verify that the date field contains valid dates.

title: Error: MongoDB geospatial query failed
message: Geospatial query returned an error
causes: Incorrect geospatial index or query syntax.
Data does not contain valid geospatial coordinates.
solutions: Check the geospatial index and query syntax.
Ensure the data contains valid geospatial coordinates.

title: Error: MongoDB text search failed
message: Text search query returned an error
causes: Text index is not properly configured.
Query contains unsupported text search operators.
solutions: Create a text index on the desired fields.
Refer to MongoDB documentation for supported text search operators.

title: Error: MongoDB Atlas backup restore failed
message: Failed to restore a backup in MongoDB Atlas
causes: Backup file is corrupted or incomplete.
Insufficient permissions to restore the backup.
solutions: Verify the integrity of the backup file.
Check user permissions for backup restore operations.

title: Error: MongoDB Atlas cluster scaling failed
message: Failed to scale a MongoDB Atlas cluster
causes: Insufficient permissions to scale the cluster.
Cluster is already at the maximum or minimum size.
solutions: Check user permissions for the Atlas cluster.
Ensure the cluster is within the allowed size limits.

title: Error: MongoDB Atlas alert configuration failed
message: Failed to configure alerts in MongoDB Atlas
causes: Incorrect alert settings or thresholds.
Insufficient permissions to configure alerts.
solutions: Check the alert settings and thresholds.
Ensure the user has the necessary permissions.

title: Error: Node.js MongoDB driver not installed
message: MongoDB driver is not installed in the Node.js project
causes: MongoDB driver package is missing from `package.json`.
Package installation failed due to network issues.
solutions: Install the MongoDB driver using `npm install mongodb`.
Check the network connection and retry the installation.

title: Error: React app cannot connect to MongoDB
message: React app fails to fetch data from MongoDB
causes: Backend API is not properly configured to connect to MongoDB.
CORS issues preventing the React app from accessing the backend.
solutions: Ensure the backend API is correctly connected to MongoDB.
Configure CORS in the backend to allow requests from the React app.

title: Error: MongoDB data not rendering in React
message: Data fetched from MongoDB is not displayed in the React app
causes: Data is not properly passed from the backend to the frontend.
React state or props are not updated correctly.
solutions: Check the backend API response and ensure data is sent correctly.
Verify that React state or props are updated with the fetched data.

title: Error: MongoDB aggregation pipeline not working in Node.js
message: Aggregation pipeline returned incorrect or no results
causes: Incorrect pipeline stages or syntax.
Data does not match the expected structure for the pipeline.
solutions: Check the pipeline stages and syntax for errors.
Validate the data structure before running the pipeline.

title: Error: MongoDB change stream not working in Node.js
message: Change stream does not emit events
causes: Change stream is not properly configured.
MongoDB version does not support change streams.
solutions: Ensure the MongoDB version supports change streams.
Check the change stream configuration and permissions.

title: Error: MongoDB transactions not working in Node.js
message: Transactions fail to commit or rollback
causes: Session is not properly started or ended.
Transaction conflicts with another operation.
solutions: Ensure the session is correctly started and ended.
Retry the transaction after a short delay.

title: Error: MongoDB data not syncing with React state
message: Changes in MongoDB are not reflected in the React app
causes: React app is not polling or subscribing to MongoDB changes.
Backend API is not sending updated data to the frontend.
solutions: Implement polling or real-time updates (e.g., with WebSockets).
Ensure the backend API sends updated data to the React app.

title: Error: MongoDB Atlas cluster not accessible from Node.js
message: Node.js app cannot connect to MongoDB Atlas
causes: Incorrect Atlas connection string.
IP address is not whitelisted in Atlas.
solutions: Check the Atlas connection string for accuracy.
Whitelist the IP address in the Atlas dashboard.

title: Error: MongoDB data not saving from React form
message: Data submitted from a React form is not saved in MongoDB
causes: Form data is not properly sent to the backend.
Backend API is not correctly handling the data.
solutions: Check the form submission logic in the React app.
Ensure the backend API correctly processes and saves the data.

title: Error: MongoDB data not updating in React app
message: Data updates in MongoDB are not reflected in the React app
causes: React app is not re-fetching data after updates.
Backend API is not sending updated data to the frontend.
solutions: Implement re-fetching logic in the React app after updates.
Ensure the backend API sends updated data to the frontend.

title: Error: MongoDB connection pool exhausted
message: Too many connections to MongoDB, causing connection pool exhaustion
causes: High number of concurrent requests to the database.
Connection pool size is too small.
solutions: Increase the connection pool size in the MongoDB driver settings.
Optimize the application to reduce the number of concurrent database requests.

title: Error: MongoDB query performance degradation
message: Queries are running slower than expected
causes: Missing or inefficient indexes.
Large datasets or complex queries.
solutions: Add appropriate indexes to improve query performance.
Optimize queries to reduce complexity and execution time.

title: Error: MongoDB disk space full
message: MongoDB server ran out of disk space
causes: Large datasets or excessive logging.
Disk quota is too small for the database size.
solutions: Delete unnecessary data or archive old records.
Increase the disk quota or move the database to a larger storage volume.

title: Error: MongoDB replica set primary not elected
message: No primary node is elected in the replica set
causes: Network partition or communication issues between replica set members.
Insufficient voting members to elect a primary.
solutions: Check network connectivity between replica set members.
Ensure there are enough voting members to elect a primary.

title: Error: MongoDB shard key not optimal
message: Shard key is causing uneven data distribution
causes: Shard key is not evenly distributed across the dataset.
Shard key is not suitable for the query patterns.
solutions: Choose a shard key that ensures even data distribution.
Re-evaluate the shard key based on query patterns and data access.

title: Error: MongoDB Atlas cluster auto-scaling failed
message: Auto-scaling did not trigger for the MongoDB Atlas cluster
causes: Auto-scaling rules are not properly configured.
Cluster is already at the maximum or minimum size.
solutions: Check the auto-scaling rules in the Atlas dashboard.
Ensure the cluster is within the allowed size limits.

title: Error: MongoDB Atlas backup failed due to storage limit
message: Backup failed because the storage limit was exceeded
causes: Backup storage quota is too small for the dataset.
Frequent backups are consuming too much storage.
solutions: Increase the backup storage quota in the Atlas dashboard.
Reduce the frequency of backups or delete old backups.

title: Error: MongoDB Atlas cluster performance degraded
message: Cluster performance is slow or unresponsive
causes: High load due to inefficient queries or large datasets.
Insufficient resources allocated to the cluster.
solutions: Optimize queries and add indexes to reduce load.
Scale up the cluster by adding more resources (e.g., RAM, CPU).

title: Error: MongoDB Atlas cluster not accessible from specific region
message: Cluster is unreachable from a specific geographic region
causes: Network restrictions or firewall rules blocking access.
Cluster is not configured for global accessibility.
solutions: Check firewall rules and network configurations.
Enable global accessibility in the Atlas cluster settings.

title: Error: MongoDB Atlas cluster backup restore failed due to version mismatch
message: Backup restore failed because of MongoDB version incompatibility
causes: Backup was created with a different MongoDB version.
Cluster is running an incompatible MongoDB version.
solutions: Ensure the cluster is running the same or a compatible MongoDB version.
Create a new backup with the correct MongoDB version.

title: Error: MongoDB Atlas cluster backup encryption failed
message: Backup encryption process failed
causes: Encryption key is missing or invalid.
Backup storage does not support encryption.
solutions: Check the encryption key configuration in the Atlas dashboard.
Ensure the backup storage supports encryption.

title: Error: MongoDB Atlas cluster backup retention policy failed
message: Backup retention policy is not being enforced
causes: Retention policy is not properly configured.
Backup storage is full or inaccessible.
solutions: Check the backup retention policy settings in the Atlas dashboard.
Ensure backup storage is available and has sufficient space.

title: Error: MongoDB Atlas cluster backup scheduling failed
message: Backup schedule is not being executed
causes: Backup schedule is not properly configured.
Cluster is in an invalid state for backups.
solutions: Check the backup schedule configuration in the Atlas dashboard.
Ensure the cluster is in a valid state for backups.

title: Error: MongoDB Atlas cluster backup compression failed
message: Backup compression process failed
causes: Compression algorithm is not supported.
Backup data is too large for compression.
solutions: Use a supported compression algorithm.
Split the backup into smaller chunks for compression.

title: Error: MongoDB Atlas cluster backup validation failed
message: Backup validation process failed
causes: Backup data is corrupted or incomplete.
Validation process encountered an error.
solutions: Verify the integrity of the backup data.
Re-run the validation process after fixing the issue.

title: Error: MongoDB Atlas cluster backup encryption key rotation failed
message: Encryption key rotation process failed
causes: Encryption key is missing or invalid.
Backup storage does not support key rotation.
solutions: Check the encryption key configuration in the Atlas dashboard.
Ensure the backup storage supports key rotation.

title: Error: MongoDB Atlas cluster backup restore validation failed
message: Backup restore validation process failed
causes: Restored data does not match the original backup.
Validation process encountered an error.
solutions: Verify the integrity of the restored data.
Re-run the validation process after fixing the issue.

title: Error: MongoDB Atlas cluster backup restore encryption failed
message: Backup restore encryption process failed
causes: Encryption key is missing or invalid.
Restored data is not encrypted.
solutions: Check the encryption key configuration in the Atlas dashboard.
Ensure the restored data is encrypted.

title: Error: MongoDB Atlas cluster backup restore compression failed
message: Backup restore compression process failed
causes: Compression algorithm is not supported.
Restored data is too large for decompression.
solutions: Use a supported compression algorithm.
Split the restored data into smaller chunks for decompression.

title: Error: MongoDB Atlas cluster backup restore validation failed
message: Backup restore validation process failed
causes: Restored data does not match the original backup.
Validation process encountered an error.
solutions: Verify the integrity of the restored data.
Re-run the validation process after fixing the issue.
